intro: Acmella affinis, commonly known as the spiny golden crown, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its striking, spiky yellow flowers that resemble a crown. The plant typically grows in wetlands and marshy areas, thriving in moist, sunny conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are composed of both ray and disk florets. Acmella affinis is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and can also serve as a habitat for various small insects and pollinators.
